detail.content: Broadway                                                                                                               NYU.edu requires JavaScript be enabled in your browser in order to use important features of the site. Student Rush and SRO Policies   Student rush and standing room only (SRO) tickets are a great way so get a deep discount on Broadway show tickets on the day of the performance you wish to see!   To make tickets more affordable to students and other theatergoers on a budget, many Broadway shows have implemented rush and standing room only (SRO) policies. Anyone willing to get up and get to the box office early, spend some time in a line, or stand during the show, can get greatly discounted tickets to most shows on Broadway. For up-to-date information on broadway and off-broadway rush policies, visit www.playbill.com.          Rush/Lottery tickets: Rush tickets are usually for students only, so be prepared to flash your NYU ID! In most cases, scoring rush tickets means waiting on line at a specified time at the theatre's box office for an opportunity to purchase discount ticktets. Beware that usually the line for rush tickets can form much, much earlier than the time that the box office puts them on sale. In other cases, the box office conducts a lottery in order to determine who will have the opportunity to purchase tickets. You don't need to arrive early to the box office in such cases - you just need a little luck.              Standing Room Only tickets: Standing room patrons stand in numbered spaces that are the width of a regular seat. They are usually located at the back of the orchestra. SRO tickets are trickier to get because they are only available if the show is sold out. There’s no definite way to predict in advance whether a performance will sell out, without actually calling the box office a few hours before curtain time. Shows that sell out often include Wicked, The Book of Mormon, The Lion King, and Jersey Boys. Also, it is likely that any show will sell out very early in its run. Unless otherwise specified, one SRO ticket is sold per person.            Here are a few of the sites our staff use to check student rush and SRO policies at Broadway theatres:   » Playbill   » Broadway for Broke People   » Broadway Spotted              CollegeTix   New York University has joined CollegeTix at Telecharge.com!   NYU Ticket Central has partnered with Telecharge.com to give students exclusive access to specially priced Broadway and off-Broadway tickets! These discounted student tickets are available online and can be ordered in advance of the performance. No more waiting in long rush lines outside the box office!   These tickets are for NYU students only . Students are required to present one valid student ID per ticket at the theater's box office; tickets must be picked up at the theater's box office beginning a half hour before show time.   Important: NYU IDs that are not student IDs ( for example: Fac/Staff/Admin IDs, Alumni IDs, Family IDs, etc. ) will not be honored for this offer. Student tickets will not be released to anyone without NYU student ID. Anyone attempting to pick up student tickets without presenting one NYU student ID per ticket will be charged the regular price or the tickets will not be released.   For a complete list of currently participating shows, visit our Steals and Deals page.          How to order:     Log into your NYUHome Account ( http://home.nyu.edu)   Click on the “NYU Life” tab on the upper right-hand part of the page. The Ticket Central channel will appear somewhere on the “NYU Life” page. (Scroll down the page if you don’t see it at first.)   In the "Ticket Central" section, click on the link to CollegeTix . This will open a pop-up window that will let you browse the offers and purchase tickets.     Remember, each person you purchase a ticket for must have an NYU student ID!   If you have any questions about this offer, please call NYU Ticket Central at 212-998-4941.              TKTS Ticket Booths   Like student rush and standing room only policies , the TKTS™ ticket booths are a resource you can use to purchase discount tickets on the day of the performance you want to see. (There are some exceptions for weekend matinees.)   Established in 1973 for the betterment of theatres and theatregoers alike, TKTS sells unsold tickets on the day of performance for many Broadway shows for 25-50% off the box office price plus a $3.00 service charge per ticket.   For example, if the price of a ticket for an orchestra seat to Aladdin is normally $95.00, the price at the ticket booth might be 50% off - or $47.50 - plus a $3 service charge.   The main TKTS booth is located in Father Duffy Square, on West 47th Street between Broadway and 7th Avenue. The electronic signs in front display what shows are available for that day.        Times Square TKTS:         For same-day evening performances Monday, Wednesday - Saturday: 3pm - 8pm  Tuesday: 2pm - 8pm  Sundays: 3pm until one-half hour before the latest curtain time being sold.  For same-day matinee performances Wednesdays and Saturdays: 10am - 2pm  (Please note: no evening tickets are sold from 10am to 2 pm at Times Square)  Sundays: 11am - 3pm      Tip: Get there early! Lines can get long very quickly - especially during good weather and the holiday season!   Satellite locations: There are 2 additional TKTS locations, one in lower Manhattan at the South Street Seaport, and one in Downtown Brooklyn at Metrotech Center.        South Street Seaport TKTS:   Location: South Street Seaport at the corner of Front and John Streets (the rear of the Resnick/Prudential Building at 199 Water Street)         For same-day evening and next day matinee performances Monday - Saturday: 11am - 6pm  Sunday: CLOSED  Matinee tickets are only sold on the day before   the performance at TKTS Seaport      *You must buy matinee tickets the day before at the Seaport branch. For example, Wednesday matinees are sold Tuesdays.        Downtown Brooklyn TKTS:     Location: 1 Metrotech Center at the corner of Jay Street & Myrtle Street Promenade         For same-day evening and next day matinee performances Tuesday - Saturday: 11am - 6pm  (Closed for lunch 3pm-3:30pm)    Matinee tickets are sold on the day before  the performance at TKTS Downtown Brooklyn.           **You must buy Wednesday and Saturday matinee tickets the day before at the Downtown Brooklyn branch. For example, Wednesday matinees are sold on Tuesdays. Sunday matinee performances and Saturday/Sunday evening performances are not available at this location.             Tip: As both TKTS booths draw from the same pool of tickets, consider using the downtown location which usually draws less if a crowd!         TKTS Time Square accepts cash, travelers checks and TKTS Gift Certificates. TKTS Seaport&nbsp; and TKTS Downtown Brooklyn accept credit cards, cash, travelers checks or TKTS Gift Certificates.                For more information on TKTS including a list of recently offered shows and answers to some frequently asked questions, visit the TDF website at www.tdf.org.            Coupon Codes   If you either are unwilling to stand in long lines for tickets, or need more of a 'sure thing' - i.e. advance tickets - there are resources out there that can help.   NYU Ticket Central has partnered with TheaterMania to provide the NYU community with discounts to a wide range of Broadway and Off-Broadway events. Whether you're looking for Broadway's newest offerings, this year's TONY winners or long-running favorites, these discounts are sure to please. If you can't find the show you want to see, check back soon because this list is updated often! NYU ID is not required for purchase or redemption.     Get Coupon Codes!       The following websites also promote coupon codes that can be used to purchase discounted tickets online, over the phone, or at a theatre's box office:            broadwaybox.com   schooltix.com   nytix.com   theatermania.com - Discount Broadway Tickets **   playbill.com - Playbill Club **            ** Free membership to these particular sites is required for discount codes. On these sites you can choose to sign up for email newsletters, which often include new codes and special offers!         Tip: When using coupon codes, the best bargain is always at the theatre's box office. When purchasing tickets either online or over the phone, service charges usually apply.            For more tips and information, read theatremania.com's article : How Not to Buy Tickets: A Broadway box office agent lists 10 "don'ts" that we all should keep in mind when purchasing tickets at the theater.                                                                      Discount Movie Passes                  Never pay full price for a movie again! Always use a discount movie pass to save $5 or more on admission!            Read More                                          NYC Events        Discount Tickets!                   Each week Ticket Central offers a selection of tickets to Broadway and Off-Broadway shows and other NYC events            Read more                                         Theater Discounts                  Check out additional offers on popular Broadway and Off-Broadway shows!            Read More                                         Sign up for our Email List                  Find out about weekly specials and deals.            Read More                                          Going As a Group?                  Ticket Central can help you purchase group tickets to virtually any event in the NYC area!              Read More                                         Half-Price Tickets!                  Get out more! Attend live entertainment, like theater, comedy, sports, music, performing arts and much more with Goldstar discounts.            Read More                                         Submit an Offer                  Does your organization have a discount or deal for NYU students? Submit your discount ticket information online.              Read More                          Contact Us   General: boxoffice@nyu.edu   Ticket Central: ticket.central@nyu.edu   Group Services: group.tickets@nyu.edu   Steals & Deals: steals.deals@nyu.edu   NYU Skirball Center: skirball.boxoffice@nyu.edu   Campus Events: ticket.services@nyu.edu     Phone: 212-998-4941   Fax: 212-995-4961   Box Office Location:     566 LaGuardia Place  At Washington Square  (Side Entrance of the NYU Kimmel Center)   Box Office Hours:   Tuesday – Saturday, noon–6:00pm  Closed on most University holidays and breaks. Each week, Ticket Central offers discounted tickets to Broadway and Off-Broadway shows, sports games, and other NYC events. View the full list            ...and much more!                  Never pay full price for a movie again! Save up to $5 per ticket by using Ticket Central's movie passes. Read More                    Ticket Central can help you purchase group tickets to virtually any event in the NYC area! Read More                    Check out our Discount Finder for insider deals, discounts and tips for scoring tickets on the cheap for events in the NYC area Read More                    Reach over 32,000 NYU students, staff, faculty and alumni via email and social media Read More                                           For the most up-to-date deals, discounts and freebies, follow us on Facebook and Twitter !             NYU Card Information   Your valid NYUCard or Alumni ID is required for all transactions and services at NYU Ticket Central.   Only NYUCard holders with full university privileges (dark purple ID color) and Alumni with valid Alumni ID may purchase tickets to theatre, performing arts, sports and other special events, or claim free tickets to shows or movies on the first day of sale or distribution.   Please note that certain offers and deals are only available with an active NYU Home account.   Learn more about NYUCard »                           Mailing List   With so much going on at NYU Ticket Central, the best way to keep informed of our specials, discounts, bargains and give-aways is to join our email listserv!     How to join:   You can enter your email address here and you will be added to the listserv automatically.                                                Email:           Please check your spelling and hit submit only once!                          Submit                          Contact Us   Box Office Location:  566 LaGuardia Place  (Side entrance of the Kimmel Center)   Phone: 212.998.4941  Fax: 212.995.4961  Email: boxoffice@nyu.edu   Fall/Spring Hours:   Tuesday – Saturday,  noon–6:00pm   Closed on University holidays and breaks                                            NYU Footer          Search      Directory      Campus Map      Events      Contact Us      Site Map      Copyright and Fair Use      Feedback         Unless otherwise noted, all content copyright New York University. Anyone attempting to pick up student tickets without presenting one NYU student ID per ticket will be charged the regular price or the tickets will not be released.   For a complete list of currently participating shows, visit our Steals and Deals page.          How to order:     Log into your NYUHome Account ( http://home.nyu.edu)   Click on the “NYU Life” tab on the upper right-hand part of the page. The Ticket Central channel will appear somewhere on the “NYU Life” page. (Scroll down the page if you don’t see it at first.)   In the "Ticket Central" section, click on the link to CollegeTix . This will open a pop-up window that will let you browse the offers and purchase tickets.     Remember, each person you purchase a ticket for must have an NYU student ID!   If you have any questions about this offer, please call NYU Ticket Central at 212-998-4941.              TKTS Ticket Booths   Like student rush and standing room only policies , the TKTS™ ticket booths are a resource you can use to purchase discount tickets on the day of the performance you want to see. (There are some exceptions for weekend matinees.)   Established in 1973 for the betterment of theatres and theatregoers alike, TKTS sells unsold tickets on the day of performance for many Broadway shows for 25-50% off the box office price plus a $3.00 service charge per ticket.   For example, if the price of a ticket for an orchestra seat to Aladdin is normally $95.00, the price at the ticket booth might be 50% off - or $47.50 - plus a $3 service charge.   The main TKTS booth is located in Father Duffy Square, on West 47th Street between Broadway and 7th Avenue. The electronic signs in front display what shows are available for that day.        Times Square TKTS:         For same-day evening performances Monday, Wednesday - Saturday: 3pm - 8pm  Tuesday: 2pm - 8pm  Sundays: 3pm until one-half hour before the latest curtain time being sold.  For same-day matinee performances Wednesdays and Saturdays: 10am - 2pm  (Please note: no evening tickets are sold from 10am to 2 pm at Times Square)  Sundays: 11am - 3pm      Tip: Get there early! Lines can get long very quickly - especially during good weather and the holiday season!   Satellite locations: There are 2 additional TKTS locations, one in lower Manhattan at the South Street Seaport, and one in Downtown Brooklyn at Metrotech Center.        South Street Seaport TKTS:   Location: South Street Seaport at the corner of Front and John Streets (the rear of the Resnick/Prudential Building at 199 Water Street)         For same-day evening and next day matinee performances Monday - Saturday: 11am - 6pm  Sunday: CLOSED  Matinee tickets are only sold on the day before   the performance at TKTS Seaport      *You must buy matinee tickets the day before at the Seaport branch. For example, Wednesday matinees are sold Tuesdays.        Downtown Brooklyn TKTS:     Location: 1 Metrotech Center at the corner of Jay Street & Myrtle Street Promenade         For same-day evening and next day matinee performances Tuesday - Saturday: 11am - 6pm  (Closed for lunch 3pm-3:30pm)    Matinee tickets are sold on the day before  the performance at TKTS Downtown Brooklyn.           **You must buy Wednesday and Saturday matinee tickets the day before at the Downtown Brooklyn branch. For example, Wednesday matinees are sold on Tuesdays. Sunday matinee performances and Saturday/Sunday evening performances are not available at this location.             Tip: As both TKTS booths draw from the same pool of tickets, consider using the downtown location which usually draws less if a crowd!         TKTS Time Square accepts cash, travelers checks and TKTS Gift Certificates. TKTS Seaport&nbsp; and TKTS Downtown Brooklyn accept credit cards, cash, travelers checks or TKTS Gift Certificates.                For more information on TKTS including a list of recently offered shows and answers to some frequently asked questions, visit the TDF website at www.tdf.org.            Coupon Codes   If you either are unwilling to stand in long lines for tickets, or need more of a 'sure thing' - i.e. advance tickets - there are resources out there that can help.   NYU Ticket Central has partnered with TheaterMania to provide the NYU community with discounts to a wide range of Broadway and Off-Broadway events. Whether you're looking for Broadway's newest offerings, this year's TONY winners or long-running favorites, these discounts are sure to please. If you can't find the show you want to see, check back soon because this list is updated often! NYU ID is not required for purchase or redemption.     Get Coupon Codes!       The following websites also promote coupon codes that can be used to purchase discounted tickets online, over the phone, or at a theatre's box office:            broadwaybox.com   schooltix.com   nytix.com   theatermania.com - Discount Broadway Tickets **   playbill.com - Playbill Club **            ** Free membership to these particular sites is required for discount codes. On these sites you can choose to sign up for email newsletters, which often include new codes and special offers!         Tip: When using coupon codes, the best bargain is always at the theatre's box office. When purchasing tickets either online or over the phone, service charges usually apply.            For more tips and information, read theatremania.com's article : How Not to Buy Tickets: A Broadway box office agent lists 10 "don'ts" that we all should keep in mind when purchasing tickets at the theater. Music Business Innovation Lab           Music Technology          Summer Electronic Music Institute      Summer Institute of Music Production Technology      Girls Electronic Music Seminar           Music Education          IMPACT Workshop      IMPACT Conference      Kodály Summer Institute      Kodály Summer Institute in Hungary     Performamatics           Dance Education          Teaching Contemporary Limón      Summer Dance Intensive           Educational Theatre          Looking for Shakespeare      New Plays for Young Audiences           Music Therapy          Nordoff-Robbins Music Therapy           Music Theory          Music Theory Pedagogy Workshop              Application Information        How to Apply     Audition Requirements     Housing & Meal Plans     Finances     International Students     Current NYU Students     Information for Summer Students     Information for Parents        Contact Us                     NYU Broadway Percussion Seminar                        Program Description & Faculty | Costs | Apply & Audition | For More Information    Overview    Intended For: All Levels    See the Broadway Percussion Seminar at a glance:       Program Dates: June 14 - June 18, 2015    Priority Application Deadline: April 13, 2015    Final Application Deadline: May 1, 2015    Required Student Orientation: June 14, 2015    Housing Dates: June 14 - June 20, 2015    Tuition: $850    Please note that performance-based and need-based scholarships are not offered in conjunction with this program    Percussion Studies       Program Description & Faculty    Hosted by the NYU Steinhardt Percussion Studies Program, with special guest percussionists, contractors, and conductors from the world of Broadway. Broadway shows and sessions will be presented on drum set, percussion, mallet percussion, timpani, and Latin percussion, by the percussionists who developed the books! For high school, college and professional percussionists, the NYU Broadway Percussion Seminar/Summit is a five-day intensive study of the skills, experience, and know-how into the world of Broadway percussion. Panel discussions will be held with leading percussionists, conductors and contractors who are actively pursuing musical careers on Broadway. In addition, students will attend two Broadway shows, offering the opportunity for each participant to experience a live broadway pit, during an actual broadway show! Dinner will be served after the matinee performance, with the show's percussionists in attendance. Past Broadway Seminar presenters have included: John Clancy and Jon Epcar (Spiderman), Charlie Descarfino (Porgy and Bess), Javier Diaz (Guys and Dolls and Tarzan), Wilson Torres (In the Heights), Dan Haskins and David Ratajczak (Mary Poppins), Pablo Rieppi (West Side Story), Erik Charlston (How to Succeed in Business), James Saporito (NYC Ballet and Tony Awards), Valerie Naranjo and Tommy Igoe (The Lion King), Kory Grossman (Broadway's Super Sub), Ben Herman (Film Recording), and many more.       For a complete list of current NYU Percussion faculty, please click here .    Itinerary & Seminars    Throughout the week, you will have the opportunity to meet and work with several percussionists and contractors who are actively pursuing careers on Broadway. A typical session will cover a variety of topics, including: an overview of the show and book, setup issues, use of technology and video monitors, artist background, subbing on Broadway, pay-scale for Broadway musicians, and many others. Artists will perform excerpts from their book, and hands-on participants will be sent a portion of a show to prepare and perform for the percussionists in a masterclass setting. Participants are typically sent 4 - 6 pieces from one show to prepare. A detailed itinerary of last year's NYUBPS is copied below for reference:        2013 NYU Broadway Percussion Seminar Itinerary*        Sunday :       9:00am : Residence hall check in begins    7:00pm : Welcome Session with Jonathan Haas and Sean Statser        Monday :       10:00am - 1:00pm : Charlie Descarfino (Far From Heaven)    1:00pm – 1:45pm : Lunch Break    1:45pm - 4:45pm : Ben Herman (Film recording session in Dolan Studios) / Javier Diaz (Hands-on session)    4:45pm – 7:00pm : Dinner Break    7:00pm - 10:00pm : Ray Marchica (Mamma Mia)        Tuesday :       10:00am - 1:00pm : Michael Sgouros (Hollow – Player’s Theatre, 115 Macdougal Street)    1:00pm – 2:00pm : Lunch Break    2:00pm – 5:00pm : James Saporito (The Tony Awards)    5:00pm – 7:00pm : Dinner Break    7:00pm - 10:00pm : Kory Grossman (Pirates of Penzance)        Wednesday :       10:30am - 11:30am : NYU Admissions Session    11:30am – 12:15pm : Lunch Break    12:15pm : Leave for Broadway Shows and Pits    2:00pm – 5:00pm : Matinee Performance    5:00pm – 7:00pm : Dinner at Musician’s Union - Local 802    7:00pm – 10:00pm : Evening Performance        Thursday :       11:00am - 2:00pm : John Clancy and Jon Epcar (Spiderman – Room 779)    2:00pm – 3:00pm : Lunch Break    3:00pm - 6:00pm : Roundtable Discussion with John Miller (Broadway Contractor) and artists from throughout the week    6:00pm – 7:00pm : Dinner in Percussion Penthouse       *Please note : The above schedule is a sample and not the confirmed itenerary for the 2014 NYU Broadway Percussion Seminar.       Costs    Below are all costs associated with the Broadway Percussion Seminar:       2015 Tuition: $850    Optional Programming Fee: $40    Application Fee: $50; nonrefundable and paid at the end of the 2015 Summer Application    Housing & Meal Plan (optional): $381 shared room with 10 meals and 30 Dining Dollars per week - see the Housing & Meal Plan page for more information       Please note that there are additional fees for all International Students . For information about financial aid and scholarships, see the Finances page.    Apply & Audition                Acceptance is on a rolling admissions basis and limited to 25 participants. We encourage you to apply early to guarantee your spot.       The final application deadline is May 1 , 2015. A complete application includes:          Complete a 2015 Summer Application    For hands-on participants only: submit all Required Materials (see Broadway Percussion Seminar)             There is NO AUDITION required to participate in the NYU Broadway Percussion Seminar.    If you are planning on attending the Seminar as a hands-on participant , then you are required to submit a placement recording. Hands-on participants will be sent a portion of a Broadway show to prepare for one of the Seminar sessions with the percussionists who developed the books. Show assignments will be made based on your placement recording, experience level, previously performed shows and repertoire, and your given interest in a specific area of Broadway percussion (drum set, Latin percussion, or general percussion).    Submit a recording (either audio or video), that demonstrates your playing in any, or all, of the areas mentioned above. This can include: orchestral excerpts, solo performances, ensemble performances, a compilation of drum set styles, or a compilation of hand drum styles.    Acceptance to the NYU Broadway Percussion Seminar is on a rolling admissions basis. As soon as your application is completed, you will receive your acceptance notification. Once the seminar is filled to capacity, it will be closed for further applications.
